1

[Rebecca]121-nate

“ [I]122-jane austen can not fix on the hour , or the spot , or the look , or the words , which laid the foundation . It is too long ago . [I]122-jane austen was in the middle before [I]122-jane austen knew that [I]122-jane austen had begun . ”[122-jane austen] — [Jane Austen]122-jane austen ’s Pride and Prejudice

* * * April 2 , [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn It is a truth universally acknowledged that [I]0-i am something of a badass . For starters , [I]0-i live in [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn , where [everyone]278-everyone can more or less handle [herself]278-everyone . [I]0-i drink [my]0-i coffee black . And [I]0-i work with [professional athletes]279-professional athletes , holding [my]0-i own in [an office]280-an office so full of testosterone that caffeine is almost beside the point . [I]0-i can do twenty - five push - ups in a set . Last year [a hockey player]281-a hockey player bet against [me]0-i on this and lost [his]281-a hockey player hundred bucks . So , until twenty - four hours ago , [I]0-i thought of [myself]0-i as pretty darned tough . And [I]0-i ’ll need to be . [The Brooklyn Bruisers]282-the brooklyn bruisers are closing in on the NHL playoffs for the first time in years . Once [[my]0-i team]283-my team makes the playoffs , a flood of tasks will head [my]0-i way . Travel arrangements . Publicity events . Ticket sales in [distant venues]284-distant venues . As [the office manager]285-the office manager , it ’s [my]0-i job to coordinate all this happy chaos . But yesterday afternoon , in a moment of sheer stupidity , [I]0-i walked out onto the gleaming ice of [the practice rink]286-the practice rink to deliver a message to [one of [[my]0-i coworkers]288-my coworkers]287-one of my coworkers . For two years [I]0-i ’d worked for [the hockey team]289-the hockey team without ever setting foot on the ice . But yesterday [I]0-i thought … why not ? It ’s like working at [a fine restaurant]290-a fine restaurant and never sampling the food . The why not became obvious about sixty seconds later , when [my]0-i Chuck Taylor low tops slipped on the slick surface . [I]0-i went down so fast that [I]0-i could n’t even break [my]0-i fall with [my]0-i hands . Instead , [I]0-i went down on one butt cheek . But that slipped , too ! [I]0-i continued falling sideways , [my]0-i arm and head hitting the ground next . [My]0-i head actually bounced off the ice before [I]0-i finally came to rest on the cold , cold surface . Immediately , [I]0-i did what [any self - respecting girl]291-any self - respecting girl does after [she]291-any self - respecting girl takes a serious tumble — [I]0-i dusted [myself]0-i off and told the two coworkers who witnessed this ridiculousness that [I]0-i was absolutely fine . And [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was fine , unless [we]292-we were counting the bruise on [my]0-i butt , which is the size of [the tri - state area]293-the tri - state area . The concussion [I]0-i sustained was n’t noticeable at first . [I]0-i assumed that [my]0-i disorientation was from sheer embarrassment . Feeling flushed and confused seemed perfectly rational at the time . [I]0-i went [home]294-home , ate some leftovers out of [my]0-i refrigerator , and went to bed early . But at two in the morning [I]0-i woke up again suddenly . [My]0-i headache had escalated , and [I]0-i felt a little sick . So [I]0-i got up and went into [the bathroom]295-the bathroom looking for some aspirin . And when [I]0-i flipped on the light , [the room]296-the room spun . [I]0-i grabbed the towel bar so hard that it came off the wall . For the second time that day , [I]0-i fell down on [my]0-i ass . The crash woke up [[my]0-i sister]297-my sister in [the other bedroom]298-the other bedroom . When [she]297-my sister found [me]0-i blinking on the floor , [she]297-my sister panicked . That ’s how [we]299-we ended up at [the ER at [Brooklyn Methodist]5-brooklyn methodist]300-the er at brooklyn methodist in the middle of the night . If [I]0-i think about the bill [they]301-they ’re going to send [me]0-i , [I]0-i ’ll probably get nauseous again . [They]301-they poked and prodded [me]0-i in all the usual places , shining infernal lights in [my]0-i eyes while [I]0-i insisted [they]301-they should let [me]0-i go [home]294-home . [They]301-they finally did , but not before giving [me]0-i lengthy instructions on how to recover from a concussion . So here [I]0-i roost — on [[the world]303-the world ’s ugliest couch]304-the world ’s ugliest couch — in [[my]0-i tiny , overcrowded apartment]305-my tiny , overcrowded apartment , wondering what the hell [I]0-i ’m going to do . Meanwhile , tears of frustration are tracking down [my]0-i face . And [I]0-i never cry . What the actual fuck ? Okay , it hurts , dammit . But the headache is n’t what ’s got [me]0-i so upset . [The ER doctor]306-the er doctor said [I]0-i ca n’t go back to work for two weeks . [He]306-the er doctor told [me]0-i to stay [home]294-home and avoid screens , paperwork , stress , and all physically and intellectually taxing situations . Another tear glides down [my]0-i face while [I]0-i try to get [my]0-i head around this . [I]0-i ’ve just texted [Hugh Major]123-hugh — [the General Manager of the Brooklyn Bruisers]308-the general manager of the brooklyn bruisers — to tell [him]123-hugh [I]0-i need a few days off . And [I]0-i had to squint just to make the letters on the screen stop swimming around . And two weeks ? That ’s just crazy talk . The timing is terrible , and [Hugh]123-hugh will not be pleased . Nor will [Nate Kattenberger]121-nate , [[the team]309-the team ’s owner]310-the team ’s owner . Furthermore , [I]0-i ’m not okay with it . [[My]0-i boys]311-my boys are on the cusp of making the playoffs for the first time since [I]0-i came to work with [the team]309-the team . [I]0-i have to be there to see it . For two years [the hockey team]289-the hockey team has been [my]0-i whole life . Sitting out for two weeks ? Impossible . Powering down [my]0-i phone , [I]0-i take another shaky breath . [My]0-i movements are stealthy because [[my]0-i four - month - old nephew]314-my four - month - old nephew is asleep in a basket at [my]0-i feet . [I]0-i ca n’t wake [the baby]315-the baby . If [he]315-the baby starts crying right now , [my]0-i head wo n’t be able to take it . [I]0-i focus on [his]315-the baby sleeping face and feel a little calmer , because [babies]316-babies know how to relax . [Matthew]125-matthew ’s dark eyelashes line [his]315-the baby chubby cheeks , and the blanket lifts gently with each quiet breath . Yesterday [I]0-i thought [my]0-i biggest problem was sharing [an overcrowded apartment]317-an overcrowded apartment with [[my]0-i sister]297-my sister and [[her]297-my sister family]319-her family . Oh , and the fact that [I]0-i have n’t had sex in eleven months and three days . That used to seem like a big problem . But now [I]0-i know better . [Four people]320-four people live in [this apartment]321-this apartment , but [I]0-i ’m [the only one with a full - time job]322-the only one with a full - time job . Fine — [the baby]315-the baby is unemployable . But [two adults]324-two adults count on [me]0-i , too . [[My]0-i sister]297-my sister is trying to finish up [her]297-my sister associate ’s degree , while working a few shifts as [a barista]326-a barista . And [[her]297-my sister baby daddy]327-her baby daddy — [[our]328-our apartment ’s fourth occupant]329-our apartment ’s fourth occupant — does construction work whenever [he]327-her baby daddy can get it . But often [he]327-her baby daddy ’s doing baby care instead . That leaves [me]0-i and [my]0-i steady paycheck . And even though [[the team]309-the team ’s owner]310-the team ’s owner has known [me]0-i for seven years , these last two years [I]0-i ’ve worried about [my]0-i job security . [My]0-i absence today wo n’t help . So what the hell am [I]0-i going to do now ? [I]0-i must have said that out loud , because [[my]0-i nephew]332-my nephew shifts in [his]332-my nephew sleep . Ever since [Matthew]125-matthew came to live with [me]0-i , [I]0-i ’ve learned that [babies]316-babies have an uncanny knack for choosing the worst possible moment to wake up . [I]0-i wipe [my]0-i eyes with the heels of [my]0-i hands and take a deep , calming breath . [Matthew]125-matthew rolls over and grunts softly . [His]332-my nephew little mouth moves as if to suckle . Uh - oh . Slowly , [I]0-i lean over the Moses basket , where [he]332-my nephew ’s sleeping , and fish the abandoned pacifier out of the blankets . Then , ever so stealthily , [I]0-i slide the pacifier into [his]332-my nephew mouth . These are tricks [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i ’d learn . But then [[my]0-i younger sister]334-my younger sister got pregnant at twenty - two . “ [I]334-my younger sister ’m keeping [the baby]315-the baby , ”[334-my younger sister] [she]334-my younger sister ’d announced immediately . “ And [Renny]126-renny is going to go work on [an oil rig in [the Gulf]6-the gulf to support [us]2925-us]2924-an oil rig in the gulf to support us . ”[334-my younger sister] Right . Fast forward a few months , and [I]0-i experience exactly zero surprise when [Missy]127-missy loses [[her]127-missy Queens apartment]335-her queens apartment for falling behind on the rent . And [I]0-i experience only slightly more surprise when [Renny]126-renny lasts just a few months on [the oil rig]336-the oil rig . [He]126-renny came through [my]0-i door a week ago , dropping to [his]126-renny knees on [my]0-i rug in an overly dramatic gesture . “ [I]126-renny just could n’t stand another day without [[my]126-renny family]2926-my family ! ”[126-renny] [the twenty - one - year - old fool]337-the twenty - one - year - old fool cried . ( Yes , [[my]0-i sister]297-my sister fell for [a younger man]339-a younger man . [I]0-i ’d call [him]339-a younger man [[her]297-my sister child - groom]340-her child - groom , except [they]341-they are n’t even married . ) Now [we]342-we ’re [all one big happy family]343-all one big happy family in [the tiny [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn apartment [I]0-i used to share]344-the tiny brooklyn apartment i used to share only with [[my]0-i best friend]345-my best friend [Georgia]128-georgia . [I]0-i love [[my]0-i sister]297-my sister , but [this apartment]321-this apartment really is n’t big enough for so much melodrama . [I]0-i ’ve been cast in the role of [Spinster Auntie]348-spinster auntie . And right now , behind the closed door of [the bedroom [[my]0-i sister]297-my sister and [Renny]126-renny share]349-the bedroom my sister and renny share , [I]0-i can hear the hushed moans of [their]341-they lovemaking and the rhythmic thump of the headboard rocking against the wall . [They]341-they think [they]341-they ’re so sneaky . Ever since [Renny]126-renny returned from [Texas]7-texas , [they]341-they slip off once a day for a quickie while [the baby]315-the baby naps . Any minute now [they]341-they ’ll emerge , flushed and happy , with [their]341-they soft - eyed glances for [one another]352-one another , [their]341-they hands lingering on [each other]353-each other ’s bodies , as if it would cause [them]341-they physical pain to let go of [one another]352-one another . [[My]0-i sister]297-my sister is kind of [an idiot]356-an idiot . Always has been . And yet [she]297-my sister snagged [a man who truly loves [her]297-my sister]357-a man who truly loves her . Every time [I]0-i think about [them]341-they [I]0-i want to throw up a little . And that was before [I]0-i got a concussion . At [my]0-i feet , [Baby Matthew]125-matthew stretches [his]358-his short , little arms over [his]358-his bald , little head . [His]358-his eyes are still screwed shut , but it wo n’t last . The pacifier falls out again . Then [he]358-his makes a breathy little complaint , and those blue eyes pop open . No matter how shittastic [my]0-i life is right now , one thing remains unshakably true : [[my]0-i nephew]332-my nephew is completely adorable . “ Hi , ”[0-i] [I]0-i say softly , and [his]358-his eyes find [me]0-i . “ Did [you]0-i have a good sleep ? ”[358-his] [He]358-his considers the question . “ Want to come hang out with [me]358-his on the couch ? ”[358-his] [I]0-i lean over to fit [my]0-i hands beneath [his]358-his heavy warmth . [I]0-i tug . And when [I]0-i sit up again , [my]0-i head gives a stab of pain so sharp [I]0-i hiss with surprise . The sound catches [Matthew]125-matthew off guard , and [he]358-his whimpers . “ S’okay , ”[0-i] [I]0-i say , [my]0-i eyes closed against the pain . “ It ’s going to be fine . ”[0-i] It ’s unclear which of [us]360-us [I]0-i ’m comforting . [Matthew]125-matthew makes a few more fussy sounds . [He]358-his ’s working [himself]358-his up to a full - blown cry . Holding [Matthew]125-matthew makes it doubly hard to bend over , but [I]0-i manage it . Barely . When [we]360-us ’re settled back again on the sofa , [the room]296-the room spins in a way that [rooms]363-rooms really should n’t . [Matthew]125-matthew sucks a little desperately on the pacifier . It wo n’t hold [him]358-his for long . [He]358-his ’s hungry . [The baby]315-the baby puts [his]315-the baby little starfish hand on [daddy]129-daddy ’s face , and [they]368-they stare at each other like [long - lost lovers]369-long - lost lovers . “ Who ’s the best little pumpkin muffin in [the world]303-the world ? ”[126-renny] [Renny]126-renny babbles . This is [my]0-i life . [I]0-i ’ve never felt more like a third wheel . Or a fourth wheel . Whatever . But this is [[my]0-i couch]383-my couch , and [I]0-i would n’t get up to leave even if [I]0-i had somewhere else to go . Which [I]0-i do n’t . [I]0-i will just sit here , stewing in [my]0-i own misery , alone with [my]0-i worried thoughts , even if [nobody]374-nobody notices . That ’s when the doorbell buzzes . 2

Seven Years Earlier

[New York]15-new york , [NY]16-ny Once upon a time , [a fair maiden]459-a fair maiden walks into [an office tower in [midtown Manhattan]461-midtown manhattan]460-an office tower in midtown manhattan . [She]459-a fair maiden ’s nervous , which is unlike [her]459-a fair maiden . But the stakes are high . It ’s a short trip up to [the fourth floor]462-the fourth floor , so [she]459-a fair maiden does n’t have much time to panic . [She]459-a fair maiden ’s dressed for the job interview in an itchy wool suit . [Her]459-a fair maiden hair is swept up in a tidy bun . [She]459-a fair maiden sees [her]459-a fair maiden corporate alter ego reflected in [the elevator]463-the elevator ’s steel doors . Two months ago [she]459-a fair maiden ’d been [a mostly - happy college student]464-a mostly - happy college student , studying English literature . But then came a phone call from [home]294-home . [[Her]459-a fair maiden father]466-her father had died suddenly of a heart attack . There was no life insurance , and [his]466-her father business was deeply in debt . [Rebecca]121-nate had finished the college semester , but just barely . Shoring up [[her]459-a fair maiden devastated mom and teenaged sister]467-her devastated mom and teenaged sister had been taxing . Now it was January , and [she]459-a fair maiden was officially [a college dropout]468-a college dropout , on the hunt for a job . [Rebecca]121-nate ’s palms feel clammy as the elevator doors part into [a narrow , poorly lit corridor]469-a narrow , poorly lit corridor . This is n’t the shiny corporate environment [she]459-a fair maiden ’d been expecting . But , hey — if [this company]470-this company has a job opening with a real paycheck , [she]459-a fair maiden ca n’t afford to nitpick the decor . [She]459-a fair maiden finds [suite 402]471-suite 402 easily enough . There ’s a sign for [Kattenberger Technologies]18-kattenberger technologies mounted beside the door . But it ’s made entirely of — wait for it — Lego bricks . [Rebecca]121-nate smiles for the first time in a week . Then [she]459-a fair maiden opens the door . Inside , [the office]2950-the office is just [one big room]473-one big room . There are n’t even cubicles — just desks pushed against the walls and abutting each other in [the center of [the room]296-the room]474-the center of the room . One third of [the space]476-the space has been allocated to a beat - up Ping - Pong table with a prominent gash in its surface . [Two skinny guys in jeans and T - shirts]477-two skinny guys in jeans and t - shirts are engaged in a feisty 10:30 a.m. championship . There are [three other men]478-three other men in [the room]296-the room , [all tapping furiously on computer keyboards]480-all tapping furiously on computer keyboards . [They]478-three other men seem oblivious to the heated Ping - Pong game and also to [Rebecca]121-nate . Tap - pop , tap - pop , tap - pop goes the ball . [Rebecca]121-nate ’s gaze travels [the office]2950-the office , taking in the hockey poster taped up on one wall . The opposite wall is blue , with three speech bubbles painted on it . 5

Six Years Earlier

[Kattenberger Technologies]18-kattenberger technologies is [a peaceable kingdom]747-a peaceable kingdom . Mostly . [Fair Rebecca]121-nate quickly becomes [the de facto ruler of [the castle]749-the castle]748-the de facto ruler of the castle , while [[our]750-our prince]751-our prince is busy reinventing the mobile web for the twenty - first century . [Rebecca]121-nate ’s job is to provision the fiefdom , which now spans [an entire renovated floor of [the midtown office building]753-the midtown office building]752-an entire renovated floor of the midtown office building . It is [she]754-she who orders the ergonomic office chairs for [each new employee]755-each new employee . ( And there are many of these . ) [She]754-she makes the travel arrangements and keeps the espresso machine stocked with high - quality coffee products . [She]754-she ’s hung a sign on the wall over the machine , too : LIVED ON DECAF , FACED NO DEVIL . [It]756-it is a palindrome , of course . [Nate]121-nate beams when [he]121-nate notices it . “ [You]754-she are priceless , ”[121-nate] [he]121-nate says , and [she]754-she glows , because [not many people]757-not many people impress [Nate]121-nate . Sure , [any asshole]758-any asshole can do a web search for palindromes and memorize : Not a banana baton ! The real style points are earned from sneaking [them]759-them into conversation . In addition to organizing [their]760-their fiefdom , [Rebecca]121-nate is also [Nate]121-nate ’s sentry at the gate . [Everybody]761-everybody wants a piece of [the boy wonder]762-the boy wonder — [financial gurus]763-financial gurus , [corporate titans]764-corporate titans , [Nobel Prize - winning innovators]765-nobel prize - winning innovators . [She]754-she guards [his]121-nate calendar and [his]121-nate sanity . Only then can [[our]766-our prince]751-our prince have the peace [he]751-our prince needs to reign over [the digital world]768-the digital world . [[Our]766-our Rebecca]769-our rebecca is not [a ruthless taskmaster]770-a ruthless taskmaster . [She]754-she knows when to use swordsmanship and when to be [the court jester]771-the court jester . 6

8

Two Years Earlier

11

[Nate]121-nate

14

15

[New York Wire]101-new york wire Sports Story of the Week June 13 , 2020

[Team Owner]2688-team owner [Gets First Stanley Cup]102-gets first stanley cup , [First Child]2689-first child in Three - Hour Window

“ Screaming is pretty common on [the maternity ward]4183-the maternity ward , ”[0-i] Nurse Amalah Dawn of [[New]103-new [York]105-york Presbyterian [Brooklyn Methodist Hospital]106-brooklyn methodist hospital]104-new york presbyterian brooklyn methodist hospital told [The Wire]107-the wire . “ But it ’s usually about childbirth , and not about hockey . ”[0-i] That changed last night , when [[Brooklyn]4-brooklyn Bruisers team owner [Rebecca Rowley Kattenberger]141-becca , 30 , watched [[her]141-becca players]2691-her players win [their]2691-her players first Stanley Cup since [[her]141-becca husband]2411-her husband — [the tech mogul [Nate Kattenberger]121-nate , 35]2693-the tech mogul nate kattenberger , 35 — first moved [the franchise]4062-the franchise to [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn five years ago]2690-brooklyn bruisers team owner rebecca rowley kattenberger , 30 , watched her players win their first stanley cup since her husband — the tech mogul nate kattenberger , 35 — first moved the franchise to brooklyn five years ago . [Mrs. Kattenberger]169-mrs. kattenberger had planned to watch game six in [Nashville]108-nashville with [[her]141-becca team]2695-her team , but went into labor a few hours before [she]141-becca ’d planned to fly down for the game . “ [I]169-mrs. kattenberger thought — this is fine , it ’s not a disaster , ”[169-mrs. kattenberger] [Mrs. Kattenberger]169-mrs. kattenberger told [The Wire]107-the wire via email . “ If the series goes to game seven , [the baby]315-the baby and [I]169-mrs. kattenberger can make an appearance at [the Brooklyn arena]4185-the brooklyn arena . ”[169-mrs. kattenberger] But that ’s not what happened . [She]169-mrs. kattenberger watched a very exciting game six on the labor and [delivery ward]2696-delivery ward , while [the medical team]2697-the medical team monitored [her]169-mrs. kattenberger contractions . “ Labor did not progress rapidly , ”[261-nurse dawn] [Nurse Dawn]261-nurse dawn reported . “ That ’s normal for a first birth . [The doctor]638-the doctor wanted to give [her]169-mrs. kattenberger an oxytocin drip to move things along , but [she]169-mrs. kattenberger said , ‘ Not until the third period . What if [we]2700-we go into overtime ? ’ ”[261-nurse dawn] Ultimately [the team]309-the team and the labor process both got [their]2699-their respective jobs done . [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn broke a 2 - 2 tie with an early third period goal ( [Trevi]150-leo , assisted by [Castro]151-castro ) and followed it with another goal just ninety seconds later ( [Bayer]200-bayer , assisted by [Drake]262-drake ) . At the buzzer , [they]2700-we were [the official champions]2701-the official champions . The reaction from [birthing room # 407]2702-birthing room # 407 was often loud and ultimately joyous . “ During a tense part of the game , [we]2700-we reassured [nearby patients]4187-nearby patients that everything was just fine . And when [Brooklyn]4-brooklyn won , [everyone on [the ward]4189-the ward]4188-everyone on the ward was pretty excited , ”[261-nurse dawn] [Dawn]261-nurse dawn said . “ [[Rebecca]141-becca ’s baby]4190-rebecca ’s baby waited . Things went much faster after [we]2700-we shut off the television . T H E E N D

[Cobblestone streets]2723-cobblestone streets]2722-new york post cobblestone streets did not pair well with high heels .
